caption.p: Cellular stressors used in hiPSC-PD models.

tr.td: Initiates apoptosis and reduces degradation of ubiquitin-conjugated proteins by inhibiting 20S proteasome activity
Inhibits protein degradation by inhibiting chymotrypsin-like proteasome
Used to induce PD-like symptoms in animal models
Inhibits lysosomal proteolysis by inhibiting cysteine protease
Used to induce aging associated degeneration of neural processes in animal models
Inhibits lysosomal proteolysis by altering pH of lysosomes
Inhibits autophagy by preventing maturation of autophagic vacuoles. Targets vacuolar type H+-ATPase causes lysosome neutralization and inhibition of autophagosome and lysosome fusion.
Inhibits autophagy by increasing lysosomal pH and preventing fusion of autophagosomes and lysosomes.
Increases autophagy by inducing autophagosome formation via inhibition of mTOR
Reduce cell respiratory capacity by inhibiting mitochondrial cell volume and membrane potential
Inhibits mitochondria respiration and ATP generation via inhibition of mitochondrial complex I
Induced loss of mitochondrial membrane potential and mitochondrial translocation via facilitating potassium transfer across lipid layers
Blocks ATP synthesis via inhibition of ATP synthase preventing oxidative phosphorylation of ADP
Inhibits mitochondrial electron transport by inhibition of complex III
Impure by-product of recreational drug design
Induces cell death due to ATP depletion via inhibition of mitochondrial complex I
Alters cellular redox reactions by catalysing DA oxidation and chelation of metals
Fungicide used to generate PD in animal models
Inhibits mitophagy by preventing acidification of organelles via inhibition of H+-ATPase
Induces dopamine release by increasing calcium response
KCl found in some foods and used as a salt substitute
Activates extra-synaptic and synaptic excitatory glutamatergic receptors via AMPA, NMDA Kainite receptors, and alterations in intracellular calcium
Main component of food flavourer monosodium glutamate (MSG)
RyR agonist that increases the calcium release from the calcium-sensitive internal stores
Widely consumed psychoactive drug present in many foods
Inhibits microtubule polymerization by binding to tubulin
Induce oxidative stress linked to aging
Removing antioxidants from neuronal culture media
Reduce the prevention of the oxidation of molecules
Synthetic compound (enters neurons via neurotransmitter uptake transporters)
Produce ROS specifically in dopaminergic and noradrenergic neurons; inhibition of mitochondrial complexes I and IV
Selective destruction of DAn used to generate PD in animal models
Induced dopamine toxicity by increased dopamine oxidation by monoamine oxidases (MAO) in cytoplasm
Induce oxidative stress by depleting cells’ antioxidants
Heavy metals present in contaminated air, water. soil and food
Mimic effect of a-synuclein accumulation in vitro
Induced ER stress by increasing cytosolic calcium concentrations
Inhibits intracellular protein transport by preventing association of COP-I coat to the Golgi membrane
Induces ER stress by preventing inhibition of disulfide bonds
Truncated version of the lamin A protein
Increases the frequency of unrepaired double-strand breaks in DNA
Induces inflammation through IL-17–IL-17R signaling and activation of NFkB

table-wrap-foot.p: These compounds were used to stress cells to explore mechanisms of PD not to cause PD in models.
An asterisk indicates a synthetic compound not naturally occurring or that does not have environmental or biological relevance.
